title: Iranian ​man beheaded teenage wife, authorities say
description: The beheading of a 17-year-old girl​,​ allegedly by her husband​, in ​western Iran's Khuzestan province last week has once again raised concern over ​the country's laws around murder and gender-based violence.

title: McConnell squares off with conservatives for downplaying 'violent insurrection'
description: • The 3 words that sparked a GOP firestorm

title: McConnell squares off with conservatives for downplaying 'violent insurrection'
The snow is melting in Ukraine. That could be a problem for the Russians
description: According to experts, a mild winter in Ukraine and the plains and marshes that make up its terrain could prove beneficial to the country, as Russia could face muddy and wet conditions if it launches its military offensive too soon. CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

title: Your Super Bowl party will be much more expensive this year
description: There's an uninvited guest coming to your Super Bowl party this year: inflation.

title: Johnson signals early end to all coronavirus restrictions in England
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has signaled an early end to all coronavirus restrictions in England, including the legal requirement to self-isolate for positive Covid-19 cases, if "encouraging trends" continue.

title: People are tired. People are frustrated. But is now the time to lift Covid rules?
description: Across Europe and the US, governments are easing pandemic restrictions. Two medical experts tell Amanpour whether that's the right move as the world learns to live with Covid.

title: Caleb Kennedy, former 'American Idol' contestant, charged after fatal car crash
description: Caleb Kennedy, who dropped out of "American Idol" last year following allegations of racism, has been charged with felony driving under the influence resulting in death, according to the Spartanburg County Highway Patrol.

title: Microsoft tries to win over regulators for its massive Activision Blizzard deal
description: Microsoft is trying to persuade regulators to approve its $68.7 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard with a series of new app store commitments that it says will put the company "on the right side of history" as policymakers worldwide debate new laws to force competition open in digital marketplaces.

title: Web traffic to Spotify's cancelation page spikes
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: A tiny, 54,000-year-old tooth is upending what we know about early humans
description: A child's tooth unearthed from a French cave has revealed the earliest evidence of humans -- Homo sapiens -- living in western Europe.

title: Biden administration believes it has until end of month to salvage Iran nuclear deal
description: The Biden administration believes it has until the end of February to salvage the Iran nuclear agreement, otherwise the US will have to change tack and launch aggressive efforts to prevent Tehran from obtaining a nuclear weapon, according to three administration officials.

title: Should parents be worried if their child's school no longer requires masks? An expert weighs in
description: Oregon's health department and the governors of Connecticut, Delaware and New Jersey have announced when their states will end the school mask mandate. Leaders in other states, cities and counties are also considering when to end required masking as well.

title: See crocodile freed from tire after 6 years
description: The 13 foot reptile has finally been freed by an animal lover on the island of Sulawesi, according to Reuters.

title: Outrage grows over player slapping and kicking cat in online video
description: West Ham United's French international defender Kurt Zouma has been fined by the English Premier League club and is facing an investigation from the UK's leading animal welfare charity after a video emerged online that showed him kicking and slapping a cat.

title: Goodbye Samsung Galaxy Note. Hello Galaxy S22 Ultra
description: Samsung's Galaxy Note smartphone line appears to be discontinued. But for those who miss it, the Note lives on in one of Samsung's new flagship devices.

title: Liam Neeson 'fell in love' with a woman but she was 'taken'
description: Liam Neeson said he found love on the set of his latest film "Blacklight."

title: Peter Thiel's Facebook exit clears the way for his Republican ambitions
description: Peter Thiel, the controversial billionaire tech founder and investor, has used his fortune to encourage kids to skip college, to back a lawsuit that bankrupted Gawker Media and to donate to the presidential campaign of Donald Trump when many in Silicon Valley were strongly opposed to him.

title: Maersk CEO sees more supply chain trouble ahead
description: Maersk has a front-row seat to global supply chains. It says more trouble is ahead.

title: Here's what happens when salary is actually included in job listings
description: Job listings can be extremely detailed, with long lists of responsibilities and required skills, descriptions of company culture and perks, and numerous other reasons for why you might want to work there. But there's often one glaring omission: the pay.

title: Leading 2015 Paris attacks suspect says he killed no one
description: Salah Abdeslam, the main suspect in a jihadist rampage that killed 130 people in coordinated attacks across Paris in November 2015, on Wednesday told a French court he had never killed or wounded anyone.

title: McConnell breaks with the RNC over Jan. 6 insurrection
description: Senator Mitch McConnell (R-KY) rebuked the RNC in a recent press conference where he called the events of January 6th a 'violent insurrection.' CNN's Lauren Fox reports.

title: Fast food prices are jumping. They could go even higher
description: Buying a burrito bowl or a burger will hit your wallet a lot harder these days.

title: Fun or frightening? A brief history of Olympic mascot design
description: For more than fifty years, athletes competing in the Olympic games have often been cheered on by either a furry, feathered or slimy friend. The Olympic mascot -- a cartoonish encapsulation of the host city's culture and history -- is so important, designs are often selected and finalized years before the Games take place.

title: Pavilion makes its own water to grow tomatoes and mushrooms in Dubai
description: Sustainability is one of the key themes at Dubai's World Expo, and with more than 190 countries represented at the six-month event, few have embodied that better than the Netherlands.

title: Olympic champion's father goes viral with expletive-filled interview
description: Zoi Sadowski-Synnott made history by winning New Zealand's first gold medal at the Winter Olympics when she won the women's snowboard slopestyle event. Little did she know that a celebratory, profanity-laced TV interview with her dad back home would go viral.

title: Athletes criticize Covid measures in the Olympic bubble. That's daily life for many in China
description: Many athletes from Western countries were stunned by the stringent Covid-19 restrictions they met upon arrival in Beijing for the Winter Olympics in recent weeks. Some were placed in isolation for weeks after testing positive, while others complained about the bland food served in quarantine.

title: Is that a nuclear plant? The story behind those towers at the Winter Olympics ski jump
description: Winter Olympians are accustomed to performing their awe-inspiring feats against the backdrop of spectacular snow-capped mountains.

title: Hillary Clinton trolling Trump's record-keeping
description: Despite repeated attacks on Hillary Clinton emails in 2016, Former President Trump's White House record-keeping is in the spotlight after accusations of destroying documents. CNN's Brian Todd has more.

title: The grim story of what unfolded during the Kabul airport bombing
description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh has the grim story of what unfolded during the Kabul airport bombing.

title: US roadway deaths rise at a record pace
description: The most dangerous way to travel in the United States became even more deadly during the coronavirus pandemic. Roadway deaths soared at the highest rate in recorded history.

title: McConnell and McCarthy split over RNC censure resolution
description: The top two Republican leaders in Congress were at odds Tuesday over the Republican National Committee's recent resolution that formally censured GOP Reps. Liz Cheney and Adam Kinzinger for serving on the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection.

title: 'Like it or don't like it, it's your duty, my beauty': What Putin's crude words mean
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin set Russian media abuzz following a crude comment he made about Ukrainian President Zelensky during a news conference. CNN's Alex Marquardt has the story.

title: Woman rescued after floating on an air mattress for 2 days on frigid lake
description: A woman spent two days floating alone on an air mattress atop a frigid lake. A pair of watchful freight train workers came to her rescue on Thursday.

title: Train workers describe moment they found woman floating on lake
description: A woman spent two days floating alone on an air mattress atop a frigid lake. A pair of watchful freight train workers came to her rescue. CNN affiliate KXII reports.
